WorkItem.Description:
I've ran the program on my mage and had great results. However, when trying to load my hunter, it get's all screwy. I get this...
 
Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
 
No Suggested Fix
 
   at Rawr.Hunter.StatsHunter.Accumulate(StatsHunter data, Single weight)
   at Rawr.Hunter.CalculationsHunter.GetSpecialEffectsStats(Character Char, Dictionary`2 triggerIntervals, Dictionary`2 triggerChances, StatsHunter statsTotal, StatsHunter statsToProcess)
 
And this is, I assume, unlimited. That is to say that when I close the error window, and Identical one pops up. This happens on load. I have clicked about thirty time and it will stop. After that, if I click on ANYTHING useful, say an gem in helm to see where it rates, the window is back, and will not leave even if I keep closing it. Tried for almost four solid minutes, and that's a LOT of windows. Any ideas?
 
 
**** From "Copy to Clipboard ****
 
I have performed the Suggested Fix and continue to receive this error. If I am posting this message without having performed the Suggested Fix I am aware that I am consuming the Developer(s) time in managing my Issue unnecessarily. **** (minor additional notation, there WAS no suggested fix) ****
 
== Version: 4.2.4.0 ==
 
== Error Message ==
Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
 
== StackTrace ==
   at Rawr.Hunter.StatsHunter.Accumulate(StatsHunter data, Single weight)
   at Rawr.Hunter.CalculationsHunter.GetSpecialEffectsStats(Character Char, Dictionary`2 triggerIntervals, Dictionary`2 triggerChances, StatsHunter statsTotal, StatsHunter statsToProcess)
 
== These are the Steps that I have tried ==
[Please fill in steps here]
WorkItem.Summary: Can't use program for Hunter, worked great for Mage.

Comments.Message:
This specific issue has already been fixed.  
Also note: As per http://rawr.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Models  the Hunter model is completely non functional.

Shazear and I are trying to get the Hunter module Cata working, since the module really has not been updated since Wrath. Both he and I like using our hunter alts and are trying to get this up and running for both of our sakes.

I must have a different language base... Or I'm just not understanding. You say it"s been "fixed" but is "completely non functional".

Very confused hunter.

A fixed defect means that someone has submitted a change that resolves this issue into the code base.  It does NOT mean that fix has been released to the public for consumption.  We only release builds to the public intermittently when a build is stable and resolves a number of issues.
